title: Exodus Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Exodus with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 40 chapters.

questions.question: Who was the brother of Moses that helped him in leading the Israelites out of Egypt?
questions.explanation: Aaron was Moses' brother and spokesman who assisted him in confronting Pharaoh and leading the people.

questions.question: What was the first plague that God sent upon Egypt?
questions.explanation: God turned the waters of Egypt into blood as the first plague to show His power.

questions.question: True or False: The Hebrew midwives obeyed Pharaoh’s command to kill all newborn Hebrew boys.
questions.explanation: The midwives feared God and did not kill the Hebrew boys as Pharaoh commanded.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "And the LORD said unto Moses, I AM THAT I AM: and he said, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, ___ hath sent me unto you."
questions.explanation: God identifies Himself as 'I AM THAT I AM' in this verse to Moses.

questions.question: What did God command the Israelites to sprinkle on their doorposts during the first Passover?
questions.explanation: The Israelites were to put the blood of a lamb on their doorposts to be spared from the death of the firstborn.

questions.question: Which sea did the Israelites cross when escaping from Egypt?
questions.explanation: God parted the Red Sea to allow the Israelites to escape Pharaoh’s army.

questions.question: True or False: Moses struck the rock at Horeb to bring forth water for the Israelites.
questions.explanation: Moses was commanded to speak to the rock but instead struck it to bring water.

questions.question: Who was the father-in-law of Moses?
questions.explanation: Jethro was the priest of Midian and Moses’ father-in-law.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "Thou shalt have no other gods before ___."
questions.explanation: This is the first of the Ten Commandments given to Moses on Mount Sinai.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the golden calf that the Israelites made?
questions.explanation: While Moses was on Mount Sinai, the Israelites made and worshipped a golden calf idol.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD instructed Moses to wear a veil after speaking with God because his face shone.
questions.explanation: Moses' face shone after being with God, so he wore a veil to cover it.

questions.question: Which mountain did God use to give Moses the Ten Commandments?
questions.explanation: God gave Moses the Ten Commandments on Mount Sinai.

questions.question: How long did the thick darkness last over Egypt during the ninth plague?
questions.explanation: There was a palpable darkness over Egypt for three days as a plague.

questions.question: True or False: Pharaoh immediately let the Israelites go after the first plague.
questions.explanation: Pharaoh repeatedly hardened his heart and refused to let the Israelites go after the initial plagues.

questions.question: What was made from the breastplate worn by Aaron as the high priest?
questions.explanation: The breastplate contained twelve stones representing the twelve tribes of Israel.

questions.question: Who was appointed as priests alongside Aaron?
questions.explanation: Aaron’s sons Nadab and Abihu were also consecrated as priests.

questions.question: What was the sign God gave Moses to prove his authority before Pharaoh?
questions.explanation: God instructed Moses to cast down his rod, which became a serpent as a sign.

questions.question: True or False: The Israelites celebrated the Passover every year to remember their deliverance from Egypt.
questions.explanation: God commanded the Passover as an annual remembrance of their redemption.

questions.question: What did God use to guide the Israelites by day during their journey from Egypt?
questions.explanation: God led the Israelites by a pillar of cloud during the day.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "Honor thy father and thy ___: that thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee."
questions.explanation: This is the fifth commandment emphasizing respect for parents.

questions.question: Which plague caused all the firstborn in Egypt to die?
questions.explanation: The tenth and final plague was the death of every firstborn in Egypt.

questions.question: True or False: Moses' sister Miriam led the women in song after crossing the Red Sea.
questions.explanation: Miriam led the women with timbrels and singing to praise God’s deliverance.

questions.question: What was the substance used to make the bricks for Pharaoh’s treasure cities?
questions.explanation: The Israelites were forced to make bricks using clay mixed with straw.

questions.question: Who was the Egyptian king who ruled during the Israelites' bondage?
questions.explanation: The term 'Pharaoh' refers to the Egyptian king during this period.

questions.question: True or False: God told Moses to sanctify the people and have them wash their clothes before He would come down on Mount Sinai.
questions.explanation: God commanded purification before His appearance on the mountain.

questions.question: What did God instruct Moses to build as a dwelling place among the Israelites?
questions.explanation: God gave Moses instructions to build the Tabernacle as a portable sanctuary.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "And Moses said unto the LORD, O my Lord, I am not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast spoken unto thy servant: but I am slow of ___."
questions.explanation: Moses expressed his difficulty in speaking eloquently to God.

questions.question: During the plague of hail, what did God say would not be harmed if they were inside their houses?
options: Those in the land of Goshen
questions.correctAnswer: Those in the land of Goshen
questions.explanation: The land of Goshen, where Israelites lived, was spared from the hail.

questions.question: True or False: Moses' rod was used to bring forth water from the rock at Horeb.
questions.explanation: Moses struck the rock with his rod at Rephidim to bring water, not Horeb.

questions.question: Who was instructed to take a census of the Levites to serve in the Tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Eleazar the priest was to oversee the Levites’ service.

questions.question: True or False: God hardened Pharaoh's heart so that He might show His signs and wonders in Egypt.
questions.explanation: God hardened Pharaoh's heart to display His power through the plagues.

questions.question: What covering was placed over the Ark of the Covenant?
questions.explanation: The mercy seat was the gold cover placed on the Ark.

questions.question: Which tribe was chosen to be priests?
questions.explanation: The tribe of Levi was set apart for priestly duties.

questions.question: True or False: The Israelites built two cities named Pithom and Raamses for Pharaoh.
questions.explanation: The Israelites built these treasure cities under Egyptian oppression.

questions.question: What did Moses do when he first saw the burning bush?
questions.explanation: Moses turned aside to observe the bush that burned but was not consumed.

questions.question: What was the reaction of Pharaoh when Moses first requested to let the Israelites go?
options: He refused and made their burdens heavier
questions.correctAnswer: He refused and made their burdens heavier
questions.explanation: Pharaoh refused and increased the Israelites' labor.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "Thou shalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in ___."
questions.explanation: This is one of the Ten Commandments forbidding misuse of God’s name.

questions.question: True or False: The high priest's garments included a breastplate, ephod, robe, coat, mitre, and girdle.
questions.explanation: These were the sacred garments made for Aaron to minister as high priest.

questions.question: What did the Israelites eat in the wilderness that God provided?
questions.explanation: God provided manna, a bread-like substance, for the Israelites.

questions.question: Who was the scribe that wrote down the covenant after it was given?
questions.explanation: Moses wrote down all the words of the covenant as commanded by God.

questions.question: True or False: The Israelites had to wash their clothes and be ready on the third day for God's appearance on Mount Sinai.
questions.explanation: God instructed them to sanctify themselves and be ready by the third day.

questions.question: What did God tell Moses to do with the tablets of stone when he saw the Israelites worshipping the golden calf?
questions.explanation: Moses broke the tablets in anger over Israel’s idolatry.

questions.question: True or False: Moses was allowed to enter the Promised Land.
questions.explanation: Moses was not allowed to enter the land because of his disobedience.
questions.verseReference: Deuteronomy 34:4 (Note: While this is outside Exodus, the fact is implied in the narrative.)

questions.question: What was the main theme of the book of Exodus?
questions.explanation: Exodus focuses on Israel’s deliverance from Egypt and the covenant with God.
